column4: I'm attempting to set up WiFi access on my Ubuntu system and am having trouble because the network requires a WEP key which no facilities seem to support (it's thirteen bytes hex). Could anyone suggest anything short of deliberately removing WEP from the network?
network-admin supports WEP.. acctually iwconfig supports WEP
network-admin doesn't offer any options at all for wireless, and iwconfig gives me "Operation not supported" when eth0 is up and "Invalid argument" when down.
i run wifi with WEP on ubuntu linux and i used netwrok-admin to set up network
I already tried iwconfig a dozen times or more. "Operation not supported" when up, "Invalid argument" when down.
rtl8139 is ethernet card, not wireless
what do u get when u run:
then u don't have wifi card
point me at distro that allways has newest packages
